p: Glycolipid biosurfactants have been reported to have potential anti-aging properties that could be exploited in cosmetic formulations. The focus of this research has been on MELs, although any glycolipid displaying anti-oxidant or anti-inflammatory properties has anti-aging potential, with rhamnolipids as the subject of patents for anti-wrinkle and anti-aging products [ 221]. MELs have moisturizing properties comparable to natural skins ceramides [ 222, 223]. Moreover, the ability of MELs to protect skin cells against oxidative stress [ 110], a property believed to arise from the unsaturated fatty acid chains in MELs, also strongly suggests potential as an anti-aging ingredient.
